title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Summary: Shifting goal posts.  Duration: five months from application to notification I was not selected.  Details:  I interviewed for a Lecturer appointment (non-tenure-track, non-research) in the Polytechnic.  I submitted all items listed in the application process.  Due to current Covid-19 restrictions, all interviews were online via Zoom calls.  The 1st interview was about three months after I submitted my application.  It was a panel interview with the search team lead and about seven other staff members (Professors, Assistant Professors, Senior Lecturers).  The interview consisted of approximately 10 questions, some of which were not appropriate for the position (questions for tenure-track/research level positions).  About one week after the 1st interview, I was asked to submit a Teaching Philosophy statement because mine was "missing".  In fact, I had never been directed to submit one with the application.  Since a Teaching Philosophy statement is not common in the commercial world,  I created what was requested on short notice and submitted it ahead of the deadline.  I was then invited to a 2nd round of interviews scheduled about four months after I applied.  The first was a mock on-line training event with the search team lead and approximately 10-15 staff members posing as students.  Due to miscommunication, I was originally asked to present my past and current research experience, and my future research plans (as if this was a tenure-track/research position).  After an opportunity to ask questions in advance of the presentation, I was told I had been given incorrect information.  In fact, I was to select any technical topic of my choice and present it, to be followed by a question and answer period.  What I later learned is what was really desired was a presentation specifically to discuss one subject area taught by the school which I would then supplement with my personal work experience.  Had I known this in advance, I would have prepared a more effective presentation.  The final interview of the 2nd round was a 30-minute, one-on-one Zoom call with one of the leaders of the Polytechnic.  We discussed my resume, work experience, and what I could bring to the university to help it achieve its goals for a transformative learning experience.  Everyone I met was very courteous and professional.
Interview Questions: Please describe for us your teaching philosophy.

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Two rounds of interviews:
1. Group Round: 
groups of 4-5 perform about 2 activities and are then asked questions about the activity 

2. Individual round:
Panel of 4-5 interviewers, 2 current leaders, a professor in the subject you applied to be the SI leader for, and an administrative member of the SI team.
Interview Questions:
For the group interview questions are based around the activities, for example:
What was the challenging part?
How did you communicate with the other members in the group?

For the individual round:
Questions are asked about how you would handle certain situations during the SI session like, what if someone doesn't understand how to solve a particular question even though you have explained it in one way.
You are also asked to prepare an activity for a mock SI session (beforehand) and are asked to present it during your individual interview.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

what is your experience in the field?

reached out by emailing the professor who is responsible for teaching that particular class

responsibilities before hand. Once

title: Student Assistant Interview

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

title: ITaP Reps Interview

title: Undergraduate Assistant Interview

I don't quite know what else to say, Glassdoor has put me through this process that I did not want to get into in the first place but now I feel like I have to fill all of this out. Is that 30 words? I just need a job. This had better be truly anonymous.
Interview Questions: Q: What prior experience do you have that you think will help you succeed in this position?

title: Web Designer Interview

Interview Descriptions: Casual Emailing followed by in-person interview. The questions were few and easy, there was no technical requirements other than just a general knowledge check. Job training lasted one day and worked directly with the boss.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

title: Accounting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jun 2016

title: Administravive Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Each department has their own process. It usually begins with a phone interview and then a formal interview with several people followed with a follow up after the process is complete.
Interview Questions: Are you able to voice an unpopular opinion?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I sent my CV and cover letter to the person in charge, without knowing if there was a position available. I had the opportunity to meet this person and talk about my previous teaching experience. It was a one-on-one conversation in which we talked about my previous experiences teaching studetns from a similar course and involvement. I also described how I have supervised other professionals and students that worked for me in the past.
Interview Questions: Have you had experience with big classrooms (more than 100 students)

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied by sending all the documents to the head of the search committee (CV, cover letter research and teaching statements). After a month I was contacted by the head of the committee and wet through brief phone interview. The interview took about 30 mins and the purpose was to explain the position better (although it is not common for the SHS to do phone pre-interviews). The opening was originally for tenured position, however the head liked my resume so wanted to consider to expand the position for tenure-track as well. In next three weeks I got an invitation for on-site interview. The on-site took 2+ days. Started with dinner with the head of the search committee, the next day breakfast with other staff, followed by number of 1 to 1 30-minute interviews and 50 talk. In the evening dinner with the head of the department. The last day breakfast and more interviews including tour and meeting the students and the dean. Overall very exhausting, but very nice people. Never felt being interviewed. Very nice talks with the faculty members. My impression was that they tried to see if I would fit well with other members and how would possible collaboration would go. Very friendly atmosphere. Only 3 candidates were selected for on-site interviews.  
Another candidate has been selected for the position and unfortunately, they didn't tell me that so had to reach back and ask twice how is the process going.
Interview Questions: What are your plans for grant proposal? (more detailed plan, where to propose, what types of grant etc)

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (Hammond, IN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Professor and the former teaching assistant, and they went through the expectations of this job.  They asked about my schedule, and what qualified me for the position.
Interview Questions: What made me want this job?

Q- are you comfortable working with people of different populations, cultures, religious beliefs etc. and will not show bias?
Q- can you keep a flexible schedule?
Q- can you use technology to teach virtually?

What does SJI mean to you?

They email a couple months later through their computer system that you didn't get the job

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Met with numerous professors to talk about what they research. Then they ask you questions about working in the lab and your past experience in lab as well as getting to know you
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in my lab

Interview Descriptions: There was a brief phone interview at first. I came in for a face to face interview with 3 people. They each took turns asking questions. It became more of a discussion. title: Director of Communication Interview

I am still working at Purdue but in a different department and am much happier.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Onsite interview with Professors you are interested in

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview on the phone - 4 people on the call.  Lasted about 45 minutes, I believe.  Second interview was a "panel interview" lasting two hours - one with peers (6 people I'd be working with directly), one with the management team (3 people).  Peers went first.  They each took turns asking  questions, and after I answered each one, they wrote notes down.  They left, and the management team came in and did the same.  It wasn't a bad or necessarily intimidating process.  I enjoyed the people I interviewed with. But you should definitely eat beforehand, and maybe bring a bottle of water with you.  My interview was first thing in the morning, and I kind of faded in the second hour.
Interview Questions: "What does success look like?"  It was kind of an oddly stated question.

title: Purdue Center for Regional Development Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was an all day process with a morning interview at PCRD with staff and key stakeholders. The afternoon was spent meeting with community people who would at times interface with the position.  Some where prepared,  some were not. In retrospect, this portion of the process felt a bit like a popularity contest (who's cuter, funnier, nicer, more male...Oops, I said it. This is Indiana, after all).  One community person admitted to me she had "no real idea" what I would do should I be offered the role. (Then why was she on the interview committee?)  The person vacating the position was involved. She had been ineffective in the role for a couple of years, but as an act of kindness, I suppose, she was offered a chance to help hire someone who would get the program running again.  I was told that everyone who interviewed me that day (19 people) would have an equal vote in choosing the candidate.  That's just plain wrong.  That to me is the department leader abdicating his role and discounting his team's ability to choose the right person.  The man who didn't have the competencies for the job was chosen.  Not a surprise.  I sign for me to look elsewhere.
Interview Questions: The questions for my interview for a promotion were professional. There were no bizarre "what kind of animal would you be" moments.  There were no behavioral questions from the department staff, however there were from the community people. (They probably relied on an internet search of job interview tactic to prepare.) They department staff questions were forward thinking, such as how would I handle real issues faced by the department, what is my understanding of relevant subjects, and so on. I was given ample time to prepare my presentation for the interview  and all questions, breaks, and my presentation lasted about three hours.  We broke for a group lunch and then I was sent out into the community, which is when I dealt with people who really should not have been involved in the selection because they were ill-informed and in some case, not well prepared.

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN)

There's no standardized protocol for interviewing or reimbursement for traveling to interview.

The graduate coordinator was also a big sell, could answer any question imaginable and was super-friendly about it all.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do with your degree?

title: MSHRM Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions:
Applied to their MSHRM; Received in email requesting an interview via Skype with an Admissions Committee member for 30mins.
Pretty relaxed; I had a bad internet connection, so we opted to just speak over the phone; DRESS PROFESSIONAL
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Why Purdue?
Why HR?
Do your GMAT/GRE scores reflect your potential to succeed in our program?
General Questions about the program

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted the online application through routine procedure. After the application, I sent e-mails to the professors I was interested in working with. I heard back from few of them and decided to pursue the professor that matched most with my previous experience. He conducted a skype interview where he asked some basic questions and went over my CV to learn more about my experiences. He seemed interested in my work. I got a RA offer few days after the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research projects

title: Facility Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1. What's your leadership style. 2. Do you have any past working experience in the related area. 3. What's your teamwork spirit. 4. Why do you think you are competent of working here. 5. What's the most important quality you nee to work here. 6.  Ask a question to the interviewers
Interview Questions: Ask the interviewer a question.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the professor I want to work with. I knew his work very well and he was the reason I came to Purdue. I send him my resume and told him I was very interested in his research. We had a couple email back and forth discussing his research and potential research topic I may be involved in. Then he agreed to hire me as research assistant.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in? What do you know about our work?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Simple and easy talked to a prof and then decide on wether or not you wanted the role. I would do it again. Super friendly great to work with and they listen.
Interview Questions: How is your coding skill?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Not formal interview and easy going. Your future supervisor will ask if you have any experience before, your job expectation and your schedule (classes). If your schedule will match the spacing they are looking for, you may be contact and be offered a position. They are not picky with applicants.
Interview Questions: What is your schedule for this semester

title: Technical Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful staff, interview was scheduled promptly, worked around my work schedule. Interviewed twice, was informed how many candidates were left. Interviewed with 6 members of hiring committee first. Normal interview questions. Second interview was with team members I would be working with, as well as director, then met with directory one on one, and finally spoke with Dean. Culture was relaxed, and very entertaining.
Interview Questions: Most questions were expected, nothing threw me for a loop. Choose your references carefully, they will make, or break it!

title: Sports Official Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: We had to write a quiz and also perform on field assessments for evaluation. We had to do repeated tests and blow whistles to satisfy the senior referees. We were given a friendly match to show them what we leanrt at the end of the day.
Interview Questions: WHy do you want to work as an official?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was enrolled into the PhD program in Materials Engineering department and there was orientation at the very beginning. Professors that were hiring gave talks, and you could talk one on one with the professor of interest. Professors are looking for the the fit of background and your interest in the project. There was a double blind choice to pair the students and professors out of preference.
Interview Questions: The professor asked me why did I think I would qualify for doing this project?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: My friend told me about this job. I sent an email to the person in-charged and I was invited to an interview. Very relaxing interview. Friendly and funny interviewers. Just relax yourself and have a nice conversation with the interviewers.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The most stereotypical interview. STAR questions that bore you to death. You need to answer quick or they hate you. Also a group interview component that made no sense at all because everyone's card said that they NEEDED the resources. It was pretty dumb. Glad I don't work for them.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you used time management to solve a problem

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen to see if I was a good fit and full day visit. For the full day visit I was introduced to staff, I gave a presentation of usability analysis of the website, then a group of them sat at a table and took turns asking me questions. They took me to lunch. Typical general interview questions (tell us about a time you failed, tell us about your work ethic) plus technical questions (explain MVC) and questions about what web technologies I knew. (PHP, Json,  Jquery, Linux). I was asked to send examples of my code to them afterwards.
Interview Questions: Explain MVC (in terms of Joomla)

title: In-Game Host Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: You walked into the office and there were two people to interview. They asked a variety of questions but they seems to just want to get the overall feel of you. They also had you have a trail run to make sure you are able to complete the tasks they are giving you. Very enjoyable. The atmosphere was very relaxed and they seemed to just want to find the right person for the job. Kept the interview very conversational and easy-going.
Interview Questions: How do you interact with people?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Purdue University in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I contacted my interested Professor. And he gave me a paper to reproduce one of figures. Though it's hard and I didn't work it out, he finally gave me the offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: 1:2 success ratio, decent GRE and TOEFL scores required; communication skills are must. Prior work experience helps, but is not absolutely necessary. Roughly 1:2 ratio of international:domestic candidate recruitment; this ratio varies drastically across different departments.
Interview Questions: English language proficiency

title: Compliance Administrator Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Showed up the night before the Interview and stayed at the University hotel (very nice) and the interview started at 8am the next day. The Interview lasted until 4pm and I met/interviewed with 6 different groups of people, students, faculty, administrators, etc. The interview went well with the exception of lack of experience for the position.
Interview Questions: How would you react to ________ situation. (Having nothing to do with the position)

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard, including job talk, but no teaching meeting. Dinners and and assorted meetings with people. Everybody was very nice and very supporting at the time. Great workplace atmosphere. No tripping question and no hostile reactions. The faculty seemed to be well informed and to have their stuff lined up properly. Visit stretched over two days, which was tiring. Nothing out of the ordinary, really.
Interview Questions: Typical: start up package, teaching options, plans for research

title: ITaP Support Desk Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basic IT questions. Know about Windows OS, Office, and IP stack and OSI model if you're going for NOSC.
Interview Questions: Just relax. You should already know if you're capable of being an entry level IT worker.

title: Program Manager Afghanistan - International Programs In Agriculture Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long. The first interview was over the phone with the 2 department heads. Then I went in for an in person interview that extended to talking with everyone that worked in the department. It lasted for 5 hours. It was a very friendly staff, but seriously overworked. I did get all of my questions answered about the position and the risks involved. The head of the department would not talk compensation until after they had talked to 3 of my work references. I have only worked at 1 company for 9 years and could not use them so coming up with 3 references that they were happy with was very difficult. After it was all done, the salary was not enough any way and I was glad that I did not jeopardize my current position to give them a reference there. They were extremely pushy about that and not willing to work around it. For the risks and work load involved, the salary was not enough.
Interview Questions: What is your current salary?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: One on one. Statement of interest. Go over background. Identify common goals and potential research projects. Talk about funding and availability. Good experience overall. Informal setting. Sometimes professors need to be chased down after classes.
Interview Questions: Research interests.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: applying graduate schools
Interview Questions: why do you want to study this area

title: Applications Lead Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (Hammond, IN) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the department secretary and scheduled an interview. The interview consisted of the whole department assembled in a conference room and they went in order where each person asked one behaviorial question. No opportunity for small talk or questions about items on my resume. I was told that was the only step, they had a few more candidates to interview and would get back to me late next week. I followed-up every 2-3 weeks and each time was told they were close. Finally after 8 weeks, I was sent a rejection Email.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when a major project was late and how was it received.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: This position did not require any interviewing. Applicants were required to submit academic transcripts, a resume with cover letter and a personal statement expressing background, qualifications and professional ambition.
Interview Questions: The most difficult encounter was with trying to decide which research group to work for.

title: Engineer Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and informal, just went to a professor and told them that I wanted to research with them over the summer and got the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Visiting Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (Blacksburg, VA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was really no interview process for me as I followed my advisor from his original institution as he moved to Purdue. That original interview was relaxed and informal, like most graduate school interviews. A smooth advisor/advisee relationship is key to success in any Ph.D. program, so learning whether or not you get along with your potential advisor is equally important as him/her figuring out what you know.
Interview Questions: How was the drive?

title: Front Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my time management skills and availability.  I was asked to describe skills that I have obtained through other opportunities that I have had in the previous years.
Interview Questions: How organized are you?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a very professional man, was called back for a second interview with another interviewee to determine where we would be placed. Asked questions and taken on a short tour.
Interview Questions: How do plan to retain student staff?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Purdue University (Lafayette, IN) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, followed by day long multiple face to face interviews with varying individuals in the department. Had to prepare a presentation on a specific program and my ideas to improve the situation.
Interview Questions: Most difficult was a question regarding goals for the department. Difficult only because at the time the only research I had done online and did not paint an accurate picture of what the current issues with the department were.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Following is the typical steps: 
1.Phone interview first. 
2, lecture
3, panel review. group interview
4. go home
5. wait their desition
6 got offer
7. not so much negotiation space.
Interview Questions: What is your purpose of life

title: Operations Manager Retail Dining Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Three tier interview: one with Hiring Manager, then director then onto panel interview, most of the questions were all behavioral and leadership style types of questions. The panel interview was over lunch which made it more relaxing. Within five days I was extended an offer.  The expeierence was positive and gave me the opportuity to show off my skills.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a situation where you were opposed on an idea or process by your direct superviosor how did you handle the situation and what would you have done differently.

title: SSIT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process suited well toward the student community. Application typically starts online where you can select which department you want to work in. My interview process was very easy personally, I met with the current student supervisor and answered some basic questions and then progressed that same day to fill out my employment paperwork with one of the full time staff members.
Interview Questions: All questions were very basic and easy to answer.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very informal was my experience. I asked for a job and I got a job.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in data analysis.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions:
questions about previous research, interested areas, classes taken.

it is not long, since I have already collaborate with my advisor when I was in undergraduate, 

annual recruited graduate students should be around 50, not all of them got funding.

It is hard now to get funding in control
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with my professor on May, 2007. Questions were regarding my background, GPA and what I look forward in renewable energy research.
Interview Questions: What do you think about working on a project outside Electrical Engineering? For example projects closer to material science.

title: Student Caller At Rallyline Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions:
IMPORTANT: This process has very likely changed since I was hired.

Submitted resume via email to the job. Heard back within a day or two to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview asked questions such as: Why did you choose Purdue? What are your interests? How would you convince someone who knew nothing about Purdue to come to this school?
Immediately after answering the interview questions, I was offered to come in for a face-to-face interview. At this interview, similar questions were asked. I had to spontaneously convince the interviewer why she should buy my watch. If I recall correctly, the same person did both interviews and hired me. She was also a student worker.
After being hired, there is about a week or two of paid training, and then you start for real on a "probationary" period for about another 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: "That's a nice watch you've got on your arm. Convince me to buy it."

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: My "interview" was very informal. Once I was accepted to the graduate school, a professor saw my application and contacted me because he had a research position opening. We discussed my interests and abilities over the phone briefly (though he already knew these because he had my graduate application) and then he described his research. He offered me the position at the end of our hour long conversation. I accepted the position about 1 week later.
Interview Questions: What are your career plans?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: one whole day interview from morning to late afternoon, including an about one-hour presentation, 1:1 interviews with about 6-7 lab scientists and managers.
Interview Questions: Technical questions about some fundamentals

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: This is an intense process. You have a two on one interview, usually with a current RA and an administrator. If they like you, then you go to a group interview where they make you do activities and they see how well you play with others. Finally there is a draft where the halls all get together and choose who they want on their staff.
Interview Questions: They ask all sorts of situational questions about how you would deal with issues on the floor and they also ask about your leadership style.

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (Hammond, IN) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions:
The University's Human Rescource Department notified me that I had been selected for an initial telephone interview.  The questions were very generic asking if I liked to work with people, if I liked to work with numbers, explaining the hours, and salary.  Next, I received a telephone call for a panel interview on campus.  This was a joke.  The panel members were very smug and seemed to look down on me.  I finally realized why, they felt threatened....  I later found out through a contact in their Human Resource area that my qualifications exceeded most of the qualifications of those interviewing me.  I have a CPA with prior University experience.  Although the job posting required prior accounting experience, not one accounting question was asked of me.  The questions were more of conflict resolution and performance problems regarding those I would supervise.
This leads me to believe they really need a "referee"  not a Business Manager.......not interested...playground stuff...
Interview Questions: How would you go about getting an employee to show up for work on time or at all?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: One interview with three staff members.  Informal setting.  Basic questions from STAR interview system.
Interview Questions: Common Purdue question - how do you feel about students?  Seems odd for a university but when interviewing other staff for positions in my unit, I did have people say they  hated students.  Hello?!!

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Selected professor, reviewed type of work  he had open for me to work on for my master degree and decided that both the type of work and professor were not the best fit for me
Interview Questions: Describe the 2 different pathways for yeast metabolism

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: The Interview was directly conducted by a panel of two graduate students and a professor, it was almost entirely technical with a few questions about research interests and future plans. Special emphasis on problem solving skills and the ability to work on multiple projects at the same time. Previous projects were the highlight of the interview, please remember that you should mention all previous projects not just the ones you think are important.
Interview Questions: Describe the advantages/ disadvantages of using a non standard software such as Minitab to conduct statistical analysis.

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: It is a very interesting experience. I talked with the advisor and am so glad he likes me. We talked a lot about the research topics.
Interview Questions: What's your weakness?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Dec 2007
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is simple. You approach the Professor in areas of your expertise. If they have a position open, they will invite you for a quick interview. There will be stiff competition because the job doesnt really need much and almost all students qualify for it. If you do well in the interview, you get the job
Interview Questions: What differentiates you from other students for this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Webex based and two professors and one secretary will sit in the room and ask you questions. Can feel free to specify any questions you have and tell them to clarify the questions
Interview Questions: Tell me your favorite project

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN)
Interview Descriptions: It was an interview over Zoom. Just asked why I wanted to work there. Then she told me about the position and asked if I had any questions. Super easy
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? How did you hear about it? Do you have any questions?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN)
Interview Descriptions: You just apply online using a portal. the result typicall will come out right before the next semester. If you know the Professor or sent an email to him there's a better chance of gettign in.
Interview Questions: you have to submit transcript and resume

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I sat in a room with two interviewers. They were nice and easy to talk to. They asked basic interview questions. just tell them about yourself about the experiences you have had
Interview Questions: tell me about your self

title: Video Production Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews and a skills assessment. The initial interview was pretty easy, more of screener. The skills assessment was somewhat time consuming and was uncompensated. The second round of interviews was with a panel of eight people and was divided into two segments: first a formal interview and then a more informal discussion without a manager present. The whole process took about 7 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and your background.

title: Student Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: It was a one round interview and the managers were very friendly. However, be prepared for questions related to your role and display your past projects. My interview was in person.
Interview Questions: What makes you interested in this job?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: two step interview first was formal and the second was a group interview that focused on technical ability. Everyone was nice and accommodating. HR took the longest in the process
Interview Questions: They asked about my availability

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews - 1 with 2 current RAs. If you make it pass that you have a group interview consisting of group project (escape room, building something, or any other group activity). Last interview will be with a REC or another administration person in reslife.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenge that you overcame.

title: Senior Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Teams interview with hiring manager. Questions were based on resume and focused on auditing outside the financial side. Questions were not super difficult and were mainly trying to see if you had background in risk strategy.
Interview Questions: What type of audits have you been a part of in the past?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Everything went smoothly, the interviewer was kind and compassionate, she asked me a few behavioral questions, she asked me to describe myself, my interests, and where I see myself in five years. It lasted about 10 minutes.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was more conversational. Interview was conducted in a way to talk about the previous experiences, what projects I have done, and skills exerted and why I was interested in the position and what I can contribute.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? What can you contribute?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: It was 2 rounds of interview. One was a group interview with 3-5 people. The second was individual, and it went pretty smooth. I got an offer for the TA position.
Interview Questions: Why would you like this position?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Had a 30-minute interview with staff. Questions were pretty easy and general about working with students. Was offered a second round but had the offer rescinded so can't speak to further process. Also had an offer rescinded for an interview in student affairs. Disappointed in the hiring process and interviews being offered and rescinded.
Interview Questions: What is something in your professional career you're working on improving? What is your advising style?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: I was given an initial virtual interview which had a time limit to complete. Then I had a interview with the hiring team via zoom. The overall interview was pretty standard.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and what you do?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Intensive interview process beginning with screener, graded test, interview, panel interviews, and department specific interviews-- pretty typical for this type of work. The people within the department made it a very welcoming, comfortable, and transparent process.
Interview Questions: Background, experience, all the typical questions as well as more job specific questions.

title: Pre-College Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone conversation
Cover letter was provided through application process
Supplemental letter was requested with directed information
4-stage interview all completed in 1 day that consisted of a one-one one, 2 panel interviews, a presentation, and a student led interview
Interview Questions: Many situational descriptions about how one many handle various cases with students.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Starts with an interview by the hiring manager/team. Then a presentation to a group of stakeholders that you have around a week to prepare. That same day, an interview with specific stakeholders and with the hiring team.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite function and why?

title: Dishwasher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions:
They asked for previous customer experience
Asked for willingness to follow orders
Willingness to learn
Explained the kind of work I will be expected to do, along with opportunities to grow
Interview Questions: asked for previous customer experience

title: Database Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The first contact was from the hiring manager, everything went well. Asked some experience based questions.

Second contact was for a 2.5 interview session with multiple teams. Questions were thoughtful, and everyone was great.

At this point the experience was positive. 

The only thing that could have been improved upon was the candidate facing portal. There are no status updates in the portal. I can say I am so thankful for the hiring manager for answering emails, because I would be completely in the dark. 

Overall positive experience, no offer.
Interview Questions:
Gave some test tables, asked for query.
Gave some linux situations asked for solution
Project you are most proud of

title: Limited Term Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: phone, casual, one person, hired within a week, I was able to ask many questions that helped me make an informed decision about accepting the position (money, syllabus development, LMS, office space, culture of department)
Interview Questions: What is your theoretical background?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quick and painless. I enjoyed the interview. The interviewer was kind and easygoing. I was called with two weeks and interviewed. I was offered the job two days later. He talked with me in a friendly way and asked a few questions.
Interview Questions: What can you offer the students at Purdue?

title: UTA Interview

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Summary: Shifting goal posts.  Duration: five months from application to notification I was not selected.  Details:  I interviewed for a Lecturer appointment (non-tenure-track, non-research) in the Polytechnic.  I submitted all items listed in the application process.  Due to current Covid-19 restrictions, all interviews were online via Zoom calls.  The 1st interview was about three months after I submitted my application.  It was a panel interview with the search team lead and about seven other staff members (Professors, Assistant Professors, Senior Lecturers).  The interview consisted of approximately 10 questions, some of which were not appropriate for the position (questions for tenure-track/research level positions).  About one week after the 1st interview, I was asked to submit a Teaching Philosophy statement because mine was "missing".  In fact, I had never been directed to submit one with the application.  Since a Teaching Philosophy statement is not common in the commercial world,  I created what was requested on short notice and submitted it ahead of the deadline.  I was then invited to a 2nd round of interviews scheduled about four months after I applied.  The first was a mock on-line training event with the search team lead and approximately 10-15 staff members posing as students.  Due to miscommunication, I was originally asked to present my past and current research experience, and my future research plans (as if this was a tenure-track/research position).  After an opportunity to ask questions in advance of the presentation, I was told I had been given incorrect information.  In fact, I was to select any technical topic of my choice and present it, to be followed by a question and answer period.  What I later learned is what was really desired was a presentation specifically to discuss one subject area taught by the school which I would then supplement with my personal work experience.  Had I known this in advance, I would have prepared a more effective presentation.  The final interview of the 2nd round was a 30-minute, one-on-one Zoom call with one of the leaders of the Polytechnic.  We discussed my resume, work experience, and what I could bring to the university to help it achieve its goals for a transformative learning experience.  Everyone I met was very courteous and professional.
Interview Questions: Please describe for us your teaching philosophy.

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Two rounds of interviews:
1. Group Round: 
groups of 4-5 perform about 2 activities and are then asked questions about the activity 

2. Individual round:
Panel of 4-5 interviewers, 2 current leaders, a professor in the subject you applied to be the SI leader for, and an administrative member of the SI team.
Interview Questions:
For the group interview questions are based around the activities, for example:
What was the challenging part?
How did you communicate with the other members in the group?

For the individual round:
Questions are asked about how you would handle certain situations during the SI session like, what if someone doesn't understand how to solve a particular question even though you have explained it in one way.
You are also asked to prepare an activity for a mock SI session (beforehand) and are asked to present it during your individual interview.

Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jan 2017

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was smooth and friendly. I interviewed with several professors and was shown Purdue on-campus and off-campus research locations. My interview clothes did not arrive with my flight, but my interviewers were very gracious and understanding.

title: Vice Chair of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University (Hammond, IN) in Jan 2017

Interview Questions: Explain how you use your analytical skills to solve difficult problems.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (New York, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Skype Interview. Talk about your research work and listen to interviewer's introduction of the research of Purdue University. The interviewer asked details in your work. Involve some concept explanation.
Interview Questions: Give a brief introduction about your research work

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Nov 2016

The individual interviews were basic interview questions pertaining to relationship building and leadership skills. The group interview was actually pretty fun and entertaining. It involved plenty of teamwork, make sure to provide some input in the activities.
Interview Questions: How would you build community and relationships with your floor?

title: ITaP Reps Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: First round is phone second is in person, the whole process takes like 2 weeks. Since it's on campus job, the salary is quiet good. The whole team is run by students as well, so the environment of the working place is awesome.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was a preliminary interview with Human Resources then a series of interviews with staff related to the position. Questions were typical interview questions, no questions to attempt to trick or confuse.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in the next 5 years

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and comfortable Skype interview. Did not exceed 30 minutes. Primarily went over functions of jobs and my background. Interviewer answered my questions in great detail. Described the town and what to expect as far as living in the area.
Interview Questions: Asked specific questions about my lab skills.

title: Undergraduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: A brief sit-down interview that lasted about 30 minutes. I don't quite know what else to say, Glassdoor has put me through this process that I did not want to get into in the first place but now I feel like I have to fill all of this out. Is that 30 words? I just need a job. This had better be truly anonymous.
Interview Questions: Q: What prior experience do you have that you think will help you succeed in this position?

title: Web Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Casual Emailing followed by in-person interview. The questions were few and easy, there was no technical requirements other than just a general knowledge check. Job training lasted one day and worked directly with the boss.
Interview Questions: What is relevant work experience you've had in this field?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The PI will ask for transcripts that showed the coursework that has been completed. Then, if the PI sees you as a suitable candidate, you have to set up an interview time with the PI.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, just met with the professor for about one hour.  She told me about the project and I told her about my background and how I could help with the project.
Interview Questions: What do you think you can add to the project?

title: Accounting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: At first ,you have to submit your profile. Then, they will go through it. If they like it, they will call you for an interview Interview might last for 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why we will choose you for the job

title: Administravive Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Each department has their own process. It usually begins with a phone interview and then a formal interview with several people followed with a follow up after the process is complete.
Interview Questions: Are you able to voice an unpopular opinion?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I sent my CV and cover letter to the person in charge, without knowing if there was a position available. I had the opportunity to meet this person and talk about my previous teaching experience. It was a one-on-one conversation in which we talked about my previous experiences teaching studetns from a similar course and involvement. I also described how I have supervised other professionals and students that worked for me in the past.
Interview Questions: Have you had experience with big classrooms (more than 100 students)

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied by sending all the documents to the head of the search committee (CV, cover letter research and teaching statements). After a month I was contacted by the head of the committee and wet through brief phone interview. The interview took about 30 mins and the purpose was to explain the position better (although it is not common for the SHS to do phone pre-interviews). The opening was originally for tenured position, however the head liked my resume so wanted to consider to expand the position for tenure-track as well. In next three weeks I got an invitation for on-site interview. The on-site took 2+ days. Started with dinner with the head of the search committee, the next day breakfast with other staff, followed by number of 1 to 1 30-minute interviews and 50 talk. In the evening dinner with the head of the department. The last day breakfast and more interviews including tour and meeting the students and the dean. Overall very exhausting, but very nice people. Never felt being interviewed. Very nice talks with the faculty members. My impression was that they tried to see if I would fit well with other members and how would possible collaboration would go. Very friendly atmosphere. Only 3 candidates were selected for on-site interviews.  
Another candidate has been selected for the position and unfortunately, they didn't tell me that so had to reach back and ask twice how is the process going.
Interview Questions: What are your plans for grant proposal? (more detailed plan, where to propose, what types of grant etc)

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (Hammond, IN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Professor and the former teaching assistant, and they went through the expectations of this job.  They asked about my schedule, and what qualified me for the position.
Interview Questions: What made me want this job?

title: Nutrition Education Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (Evansville, IN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with a small panel. The Regional Director, County Supervisor for Each Office. The position covers two countries. Everyone was polite. Each had a set of questions to ask and they took turns.
Interview Questions:
Q- are you comfortable working with people of different populations, cultures, religious beliefs etc. and will not show bias?
Q- can you keep a flexible schedule?
Q- can you use technology to teach virtually?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Purdue University in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview where they check how deep is your knowledge and they check your GPA and testing scores & your work experience .It is not difficult but its important that you answer quite confident and honestly
Interview Questions: Technical Knowledge, Undergrad Scores

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. Interviewer just asked about information on my resume. It was very short, very simple, and very easy to obtain a researcher position. I'm not sure if all research positions at Purdue are like that, but mine was.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you're qualified to perform this job?

title: Marketing and Promotions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: This position is with the athletics department at Purdue University under the marketing and promotions department.  I applied on-line and then was selected to interview in person.  The interview was with four members of the department asking about experience, with a few behavioral and situational questions.  Overall, the interview process was well organized and I had a positive experience.
Interview Questions: How would you handle interacting with famous alumni that come back to do events with us?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Mar 2016

Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experiences. Tell me about the type of jobs that you have performed.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview with faculty advisor, interview with potential school/college, you may or may not get a call ahead, but definitely will interview in person and sometimes it involves a few days stay.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone conversation over the phone and applied to the school. Asked about past experience and background. The conversation was directly with the advisor. Transcripts, Test scores and other application material needed to be submitted. Then the graduate school evaluated and provided admission. The offer later was generated by the department. Visa letters were generated by ISS office.
Interview Questions:
Past projects,
Courses taken

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Purdue University (Hammond, IN) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very lengthy process and was often times condescending when asked questions. I believe my age was of concern as I have a great amount of experience at a young age.
Interview Questions: How do you plan to manage staff to meet necessary outcomes

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a professor (potential academic advisor) about academic interests. Was asked questions on detailed research experience on the resume. Talked about his research labs and equipment. Asked the professor some question that I was interested in.

title: Secretary IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Nov 2015

I was asked to bring in design and writing samples. I had my first interview with my potential peers. I was called back the following day for a second interview with my potential supervisor. I was offered the job at my second interview.

title: Wellness Coordinator Interview

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very standard for a faculty position. Over two days presented a research seminar, a chalk talk, and met with many people. One lunch with faculty and one lunch with grad students/postdocs and 2 dinners with faculty. Being far away from a major airport getting to Purdue is a pain, especially in winter.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Oct 2015

Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with the Technical Assistance Program?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews. One individual in the fall semester and one group in the spring semester. The individual was conducted with one RA and one pro staff member. Interview Questions:
Why do you want to be an RA?
What kind of community do you want to build?
What does SJI mean to you?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview process was good, relaxed, and informative.  The interview consisted of a phone screen.  Followed up the phone screen with a one on two interview with the manager and the lead.  Overall it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: What are the pillars of object oriented programming?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Email the professor and got a skype interview. Two research faculty and RA students were in charge of it. Some basic technical questions around the resume. Got an offer after two months.

title: Research Scientist Interview

1. Presentation for one hour about PhD research and then Q&A
there are some good technical questions

General personality questions and some technical questions

4. Dinner with team members
Interview Questions:
1. Why do you choose Dow?

3. What is your strengths and weaknesses?
It took very long time for me get their final decision.

title: Front Desk Interview

title: Sponsored Program Interview

Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with 2 people.  They only mentioned one before the interview.  I made it through the first interview but was not invited back for the second interview.  The people I interviewed with took turns asking questions and are required to right down everything I said.  Interview questions were standard questions.  They email a couple months later through their computer system that you didn't get the job

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: One 10-minutes' one-on-one phone-screen interview mostly talking about casual topics like vacations, foods, etc. No technic questions at all. I guess they just wanted to have a sense of my language and communication skills.
Interview Questions: How did you spend you spring festival vacation?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University
Interview Descriptions: Met with numerous professors to talk about what they research. Then they ask you questions about working in the lab and your past experience in lab as well as getting to know you
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in my lab

title: Secretary IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief phone interview at first. I came in for a face to face interview with 3 people. They each took turns asking questions. It became more of a discussion. I felt comfortable almost immediately. After I spoke with them, I went to a member of the IT team and had a technical interview about computers and basic software.
Interview Questions: How do you organize your day?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied and was awarded an offer through the department I applied to. After the offer, there was a "retreat" weekend where you were flown to Purdue and talked with professors, grad students, staff, etc.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Purdue University

Since there is teaching involved, for non-English speaker, whose native language is not English, a test for English proficiency is also required before you can take the job.
Interview Questions: Why you fit in this position

title: Extension Educator Interview

Interview Descriptions: I was the only candidate for the position, I was given very basic questions to respond to and asked to give a presentation. Very easy interview process as the company was eager to fill the position, as it had been vacant for over a year.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a program you would deliver to the community?

title: Research Programmer Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was an easy interview process. I knew my future boss through a different program. Initially, I worked for him for free, because I thought my inexperience made working there not worth paying me. However, once I submitted my first rough draft he hired me on. He did briefly interview me between my volunteering and payed work.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have programming?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was 2 hours long and compromised of both a technical and a behavioral portion. The response from my application was quick and the interview was set up in the same week. I expressed my interest through email and was contacted back with a resume request. After the interview, they liked me enough to hire me on the spot.
Interview Questions: What is one aspect of web development that interests you the most and why?

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview through Skype. The questions are specific questions about research experience I put on the resume. The interview was not long. The interviewer concerned how my background matched the requirements of the project.
Interview Questions: Have you published anything from your reseach?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was only one online application, there was no face to face interview. The online application was very basic, they asked about your general personal information, what classes you took, how you did on those classes, etc. I applied online and was contacted for the position via email one month later right before new semester started.
Interview Questions: It asked me all the Statistics classes I took and what grades I received.

title: Director of Communication Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were 17 people in the interview, all on a conference call. It was ridiculous. None had a clue as to what my job would entail except the person who was hiring me. Yet we went round so that everyone could ask questions about how I would do my job. By the time the job interview was over, I had decided I had no desire to work with these people and I declined the eventual offer. I am still working at Purdue but in a different department and am much happier.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a conflict with your coworker. What was it, and how was it resolved?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Purdue University (Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
These are the main questions I was asked. Some of these can also be asked in various ways 
Submit application materials 
Onsite interview with Professors you are interested in
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself 
How do your interest line with ours?

title: Student Web and Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Apr 2015

Interview Questions: What programming languages do  you know?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I received a phone call to set up an in-person interview.  The interview was a group panel with 5-6 persons.  One was the hiring leaders, but not a supervisor.   The interview was of a set of questions that were pre-arranged and the questions were designed by the group panel.  As the questions were asked, each person would take notes.  I attempted to make eye contact with each person while paying attention to the person posing the question.  The questions ranged in topic, but mainly were to explain how I would fit into the normal work expectations.  I was explained that there would be a second with the department director and a third with the Department Head.  The interview lasted approximately one hour.
Interview Questions: Give an example how you previously dealt with a frustrating situation?

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Purdue University (West Lafayette, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Submit your resume
Phone Interview
Second phone interview
Face to face interview
Tour of the workplace
Offer

Due to the requirements of equal opportunity employer requirements, every candidate is asked the same questions. So you can expect the questions to be very generic.

title: Data Analyst Interview

title: Tech Interview

title: Data Analyst Interview
